message.content:
Step 1. Calculate the Debt to Asset Ratio.  
• From the balance sheet, total liabilities are the sum of Accounts Payable and Taxes Payable.  
 Accounts Payable = 7,566,370.00  
 Taxes Payable = 38,779.91  
 Total Liabilities = 7,566,370.00 + 38,779.91 = 7,605,149.91  
• Total Assets = 23,717,525.01  
• Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets  
 = 7,605,149.91 / 23,717,525.01 ≈ 0.32  

Step 2. Calculate the Gross Profit Margin.  
• From the income statement:  
 Gross Profit = 279,378.77  
 Total Revenue = 775,598.77  
• Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%  
 ≈ (279,378.77 / 775,598.77) × 100% ≈ 36.00%  

Step 3. Calculate the Operating Cash Flow Ratio.  
• From the cash flow statement:  
 Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = -967,147.02  
• The operating cash flow ratio is calculated as:  
 Operating Cash Flow Ratio = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities / Total Current Liabilities  
 = -967,147.02 / 7,605,149.91 ≈ -0.13  

Thus, the final computed ratios are as follows:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.32",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "36.00%",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "-0.13"
  }
}
